alert.note: Alert for Chilton (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 4:20AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Chilton County through 445 AM CDT... At 420 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pooles Crossroads, or near Clanton, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clanton, Verbena, Pooles Crossroads, Mitchell Lake and Cooper. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
